description: This course will cover everything you need to create a presentation in PowerPoint. These episodes start at the very beginning by exploring the PowerPoint environment, how to add slides to a presentation, insert text and images into slides, create tables and charts, apply design themes, enhance with animation, and prepare to deliver your final presentation.
descriptionMD: This course will cover everything you need to create a presentation in PowerPoint. These episodes start at the very beginning by exploring the PowerPoint environment, how to add slides to a presentation, insert text and images into slides, create tables and charts, apply design themes, enhance with animation, and prepare to deliver your final presentation.
name: PowerPoint 2016 for Mac
subtitle: Presentation application to create slide shows

episodes.description: This course will cover everything you need to create a presentation in PowerPoint. These episodes start at the very beginning by exploring the PowerPoint environment, how to add slides to a presentation, insert text and images into slides, create tables and charts, apply design themes, enhance with animation, and prepare to deliver your final presentation.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne kick off their series on PowerPoint for Mac. They begin by familiarizing you with PowerPoint through a short history lesson, pricing tiers, PowerPoint 2016 vs. Office365, and a basic command set.
episodes.title: Introduction to PowerPoint

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne introduce you to the PowerPoint 2016 user interface. Here you will learn about the Ribbon, Menus, Quick Access toolbar, and Status bar. Finally, they will quickly look at the slideshow/presentation interface.
episodes.title: The PowerPoint Environment

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with Slides in PowerPoint 2016. They start by showing you how to create a new Slide and applying a Layout. Then they look at editing Slides and Layouts; rearranging slide order, duplicating, deleting, hiding slides. Finally, they explain selecting and modifying Slide or Object content.
episodes.title: Slides

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne begin explaining how to work with text in PowerPoint 2016. They start by showing you how to add text to a placeholder, autosizing text, and Auto-Correct options. They also show adding text to the Speaker Notes and inserting text box into a blank slide.
episodes.title: Work with Text

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue explaining how to work with text in PowerPoint 2016. They pick back up by looking at Outline view, working with cut, copy, and paste, and performing Find and Replace.
episodes.title: Work with Text Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at Character and Paragraph formatting in PowerPoint 2016. Here you will learn the the difference between Characters and Paragraphs, as well as the common attributes that can be manipulated. They also discuss some foundational typographical knowledge.
episodes.title: Character and Paragraph Formatting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore applying Character and Paragraph formatting of the text on a PowerPoint slide. They demonstrate formatting techniques like case, color, spacing, tracking, and symbols for Characters and alignment, line spacing, and indents for Paragraphs. Other topics covered includes Bullets and Numbering.
episodes.title: Format Text

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne finish exploring applying Character and Paragraph formatting of the text on a PowerPoint slide. Here they show you how to effectively work with Tab spacing as well as formatting text in the Speaker Notes section.
episodes.title: Format Text Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate employing images in a PowerPoint presentation. They kick things off by looking at how to insert an image into a slide. Then they look at sizing images, file type importance, and the Picture Format tab.
episodes.title: Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate employing images in a PowerPoint presentation. They jump back in by finishing their demonstration of picture formatting, here going through the last few options of the Picture Format tab and then discussing how to deal with text and image wrapping.
episodes.title: Images Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore Format Slides and Themes. This episode is al about changing the look and feel of the entire presentation and the slides therein. They will look at default design themes and even make custom themes. Other topics covered include formatting the background and design ideas.
episodes.title: Format Slides and Themes

episodes.description: In this episode, Zac and Vonne show us how to add and format shapes in PowerPoint. Vonne also covers stacking order, the selection pane, aligning, and grouping.
episodes.title: Shapes

episodes.description: Zac and Vonne continue working with shapes in PowerPoint, covering topics such as merging shapes, editing points, shapes with modifying handles, and adding text to shapes.
episodes.title: Shapes Part 2

episodes.description: Zac and Vonne take a look at using SmartArt in PowerPoint. SmartArt is a combination of shapes and text that help to convey data in a graphical format. They demonstrate how easy it is use and add them to our presentation. Vonne shows us how to add shapes to SmartArt, delete and modify shapes, apply styles, and use the list view in a variety of different types of SmartArt available in the SmartArt library.
episodes.title: SmartArt

episodes.description: In this episode, Zac and Vonne discuss tables in PowerPoint. Vonne demonstrates the different parts of a created table and show how they can be manipulated and formatted. She then shows how to create a table and add data as well as formatting to make the table display the way we want for a presentation.
episodes.title: Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Zac and Vonne discuss the purpose and creation of charts in Microsoft PowerPoint. Charts allow us to summarize and compare data in graphical representation. Vonne reviews the terminology associated with charts, chart types, how to insert a chart, add data to a chart, add and modify chart elements, as well as format charts for a presentation.
episodes.title: Charts

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zac discuss how to add animations to a PowerPoint presentation. They demonstrate adding basic animations, modifying animations and adding multiple animations. They also look at using motion paths and custom paths with animations. They finish up by demonstrating adding sounds to animations and using animations with SmartArt.
episodes.title: Animation

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zac demonstrate working with slide transitions in PowerPoint. They add slide transitions to a single slide and to all slides. They look at the different effect options available for some slide transitions. They also show how to add sounds and modify the duration of slide transitions.
episodes.title: Slide Transitions

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at the final stages of creating a PowerPoint presentation. They go over using spell check and the thesaurus. They discuss printing options, hiding slides, adding headers and footers, and running your presentation.
episodes.title: Prepare a Presentation

episodes.description: Vonne and Mike continue to look at the final stages of creating a PowerPoint presentation. They explore the different options available for sharing, exporting, and saving a PowerPoint presentation in different formats.
episodes.title: Prepare a Presentation Part 2
